website_summaries.verdict: Nice features to vacuum multiple types of flooring from a popular, high-quality brand.
pros: Dyson is known for its "ball" design that makes turning easy, and this model is no different
It is also self-adjusting to go from carpet to wood, tile, or vinyl without missing anything
The HEPA filter makes it great for those with allergies
cons: Some users find it difficult to maintain suction on ultra-plush carpets

website_summaries.verdict: The top of the line from Dyson. An excellent choice if you have pets and require extreme suctioning power to clean your flooring.
pros: A powerful machine with unbeatable suction
Boasts superb performance on any floor surface
Features allergy reduction technology without filters
cons: It's an investment, but you get impeccable quality for the price

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on carpet
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does not work on carpet and rugs. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Ask Dyson if it works on carpet?
customer_reviews.text: Be advised that IT DOES NOT WORK ON CARPET!!! On hardwood, tile and indoor/outdoor carpeting it's fine, but not on short, medium, or plush pile carpet. One would think that they would not have to ask whether a vacuum at this price point works on typical carpeting. It's so disappointing that right out of the box I was instructed to remove a part so that it might work on my carpet. IT STILL DIDN'T! With a design flaw so serious, I don't know how the product was cleared to be sold to the public. I returned mine and I would not consider purchasing another Dyson if this is the company's accepted practice. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: pressen

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING vacuum!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING vacuum! I have owned a Dyson vacuum before and that one lasted almost 10 years but I had noticed it wasn't picking up as well as it had in the past. This one is great! After one round of my house it was very clear my last one wasn't picking up at all! Love love love this vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janis v N

customer_reviews.title: If you're waffling, Just do it!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Incredible suction - Easy to Clean - Reusable filter - Does not damage wood floors - Extra long hose Cons: - Using the hose in tight spaces is difficult - It's not great for stairs
customer_reviews.author: Danie

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on thick carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Have had a Dyson since 2003, works awesome. Wanted to replace with this vacuum. Upon arrival was pleased with function but not design. Falls over easily if not locked, and it will not function at all on any carpet that is somewhat thick. It just binds up and stops dead in its own tracks. Super disappointed that this vacuum did not work as stated. Returned and kept old vacuum that works perfectly on thicker carpet.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Replacement filters hard to find, need to be cleaned every month.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. We have been trying all afternoon to figure out the part number for replacement filters. I want a second set. They need to be washed out every month, and take 24+ hours to dry. I waited over an hour on chat after being placed on hold, can’t find the exact part numbers anywhere on the internet, and they aren’t in the manual. Too frustrating. Finally, talked to customer service. The post filter is not available. The pre-filter is, but the part is not available on Amazon. The model number for this machine is UP19, and the filters for UP16 should work if I can find them.
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: The absolute worse
customer_reviews.text: Please save yourself a lot of frustration and don’t by this. It must be a design flaw, but you can’t even vacuum half a room before the elbow-curved tube around the ball cloggs. There is actually more dirt in the clogged portion then is in the cylinder part. I have to take the ball off EVERY TIME, then sweep up; kind of ridiculous, right? Please don’t waste all that money. I had a Dyson before and LOVED it.....so disappointed in this one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm totally disappointed in this sweeper
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally disappointed in this sweeper. I've had dyson sweepers for many years, loved them and couldn't wait to get a new one with lots of "suck" power. Unfortunately, this model's head cannot be raised or lowered. The brush completely stops moving on our new, thicker carpet and I can't push the sweeper at all. There would be no problem if it would raise and lower like our past dysons. I've thrown the box the sweeper came in away but I'm going to hope I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Plastic flimsy junk
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. It feels so flimsy. Its hard to stand on its own if you use the extensions, the machine falls on its side. I had my last Dyson, not with the ball. It held up for 10 years with pets. I will be lucky to get 1 year out of this. This is not Dyson quality.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on all carpets
customer_reviews.text: in one room, according to Dyson, my pad is too thick (I did put a good quality pad but nothing extreme). The rotating bar locks up and the suction is so strong it pulls up the carpet. Talked to Dyson who said there is nothing that can be done about it because I bought it from Amazon and not from them. So I am stuck with an expensive machine that does not work in all rooms and I cannot get any help from Amazon. Amazon support told me to contact the manufacturer. Run around. Wish I purchased it from Walmart, Target or any other local store.
customer_reviews.author: Likes to Read

customer_reviews.title: Breaks frequently
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this vacuum for about 7 months, and it has started breaking every time I use it. Consumer Reports warned me that Dyson products break frequently. I should have bought the protection plan, or a Shark vacuum. I paid a lot of money for this thing, and it's not even a year old! It should not be breaking all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Dyson puts all other vacuum cleaners to shame
customer_reviews.text: After using Dyson Ball Multi Floor 2, I realized all other vacuums I had ever owned were utter crap. This vacuum sucks up dirt like a champ. It removed so much dust from my carpet that it left me wondering if previous cleaners had just been decorative, mere poseurs, deceptive noise makers that failed to perform and fulfill their purpose. Besides being THE best vacuum I've ever owned, Dyson has a really nice design and is easy to move around. It's better at reaching corners than all other vacuum cleaners I've owned and it doesn't give me as much of a backache. The canister and filter are easy to clean too. Overall just a great product, design and investment!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Mailhot-Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I had the shark rotator professional, and it just wasn't doing the job. I was pretty disappointed since I paid $200 for it, but you live and learn. So I told my husband I wanted a Dyson for my birthday. It came and I'm so happy! 3 clicks to get it together and it is very easy on the eyes. Then I did a practice run over some carpet powder. It picked it up after one sweep. My shark didn't do that. I had to go over things multiple times. Very happy with this purchase and I will buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The easy turning is an added bonus
customer_reviews.text: We have never been more impressed with a vacuum. The amount of dirt we've been able to pick up is outstanding. I had just vacuumed a few days before this vacuum arrived. After running it over the same floors, we had to dump the canister at least 2x's! The easy turning is an added bonus. I've had issues with edge cleaning with other vacuums. You had to pull the debris away from the wall to get the vacuum to pick it up. Not with this unit...it picked up everything near the baseboards. It is very lightweight and has a very long cord. We couldn't be more pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: mrswago

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking if you have extremely plush carpet, it will NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Our Dyson Animal brushes started working only intermittently, called Dyson and was told it was probably something in the ball and to take to a local repair shop where the cost would be $100 to look at it. Decided since it was probably at least 12 yrs old, we'd just get a new one. This dyson is great on porcelin, wood, tile, and berber and low pile carpet. The brushes will not even turn on our plush, high pile carpet...nor can you push or pull it. The dyson animal was difficult to use on plush carpet but at least the brushes turned. Dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this vacuum is great! Except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy I finally splurged and bought a dyson! This vacuum has powerful suction. The canister can hold a lot and it's super easy to empty. The attachments are easy to get too, and use. The one major con (see pictures) when putting the hose back in the yellow portion gets stuck and will not go all the way down. This is incredibly frustrating. Sometimes I can get it down in 2-3 tries, but the time I took this pic, it took 20 minutes to force the thing down. The quality of this hose piece does not match the quality of the rest of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hinkel

customer_reviews.title: Coming from a DC25, I can say that this is a downgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Dyson as a company. Their early products and high-end products are great! The build-quality of this Multi Floor 2 is quite a bit lower in quality than my previous DC25. The suction seems almost as good, but I'm leery of the build-quality and it gets a lot hotter than my old model. Not sure if this is a defect. I'm going to keep it because the warranty is good enough that it'll probably be okay? *Edit* - 8 months after purchase it almost doesn't work at all. I'll update as we begin and go through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is very hard to push on tall plush carpet. Works well on hard floors and flat carpet.
customer_reviews.author: TOM W.

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Update: I HATE THIS VACUUM! Biggest waste of money. It is exhausting to clean my house. Its so very heavy, the “extension cord” is a joke, it DOES NOT EXTEND! The ball heats up a lot. The carpet roller turns on when not using it on carpet so I have to keep turning it off. It is very noisy. It’s unstable and wobbles and tips over. It doesn’t work on high pile rugs or carpet. It’s expensive. Pretty much everything negative you read is true. Trust a person that never ever writes reviews and don’t buy this! You’re welcome ;)
customer_reviews.author: DPG

customer_reviews.title: Dyson SUCKS ..only in this review!
customer_reviews.text: This was possibly the worst vacuum cleaner I ever bought! .. Had it for only 3 1/2 weeks ..and the wand wouldn't suck. It's seems that where it connects at the base of the vacuum ..wouldn't close off completely ..design flaux .. I guess. Anyway, sent it back to Amazon and got me a "trusty" Shark instead. They always work great. I just wanted to try a Dyson to see what I was missing. Apparently, I was "missing" more(dirt) with the Dyson than I ever did with my shark! So, ...there ya go!
customer_reviews.author: Moodle10

customer_reviews.title: It leaves more dirt than it picks up.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is not working properly. I bought it a little over a month ago, and it is already not picking up the dirt. I have two dogs and picking up the dog hair is really important to me. It looks like it picks it up, but it does not, it clumps up on the floor and it smells like an old vacuum, the ones that have the bags that need to be replaced. I was getting ready to send it back and when I logged into my account I see it says the last day to return it was August 29. Anyone knows what to do here?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For $200 it is good, but be warned
customer_reviews.text: For $200 it is good, but be warned, anything more than a short rug height will cause this to not really work. The vacuum is great on hardwood, and super minimal runners, but once you hit any form of height for the carpet the brush will stop from to much resistance and it will just be suction like on the hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hotch

customer_reviews.title: Very unsatisfactory product and customer service!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I am writing about my dissatisfaction with this product without a reply. It was sold as coming in original packaging, which it wasn't. It also came without a manual or the attachments. The vacuum spits out dirt instead of suctioning it the canaster. I would rather not waste the resources of returning this vacuum if I could figure out how to make it work properly. but if not, I will just waste more resources returning it and buy local.
customer_reviews.author: liz s.

customer_reviews.title: My first and last dyson
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum did great, for two months. We have extensive hardwood floors, two non-shedding dogs and kids. Which means I use it often (like 2 times a day). After the return window closed (of course) it stopped being as efficient. And now the rotating brush stoped work. Additionally, the hose to vacuum stairs is the worst design going- very awkward. I have purchased new filters to try and help with suction, cleaned out the whole unit. Just very frustrating to have spent money on a vacuum this expensive, to now have to try and “troubleshoot” the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Stay at home mom

customer_reviews.title: too much suction!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had and used Dysons for years. Various styles. Decided to get a new one. Tried using it this morning. It won't work in our home; the small rugs, it literally sucks up! The shag rugs, it cannot be pushed across (suction so strong). Sooo disappointed to have to return this. Grateful my 'old' one is still working. Have used Dysons on those carpets for decades. Called the company they said 'new Dysons are so strong they cannot be used on high pile or shag carpeting'. Dang.
customer_reviews.author: Alice in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Truly lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, beyond happy with this vacuum. Suction is unreal and consistent across all surfaces. I think it's worth the extra cost, I had my last dyson for close to 13 years. Maneuverability is great on the ball. I had a bit of an issue with the wand insertion (that sounded bad, but it's accurate), but after a month of use it's been "broken in" to a point that I no longer have any issues. Great for a house with pets, even fine fine cat hair is swept up with ease. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: eroars

customer_reviews.title: Great price if you want a decorative vaccum thay does nothing.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. I was under the impression I was ordering a WORKING product. Item was totally beat up, came with zero instructions for assembly, and has NO suction. It looks like someone bought it, broke the pieces, returned it and amazon put it in a box and sold it again. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Photojenic92

customer_reviews.title: Wow, so much power
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, I vacuumed my entire house once with my old vacuum and then again with this dyson. We do not have any pets so there is not pet hair to be picked up, but the dyson somehow managed to fill nearly a quarter of the canister with dust and dirt that my old vacuum simply missed. Extremely happy with this vacuum and the shipping was fast. I was hesitant at first about the whole dyson hype but now will not go any other way.
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on carpet
customer_reviews.text: First off, it has great suction and works well on tile and hardwood. I can’t, however, use it on my carpet. It won’t even push and there is no height adjustment. So, mulifloor means hardwood or tile, not carpet. Also, it feels cheap with cheap plastic parts. Getting the crevice tool out and back in is a chore and always feels like it’s going to break. So disappointed. First time I’ve purchased a Dyson and I never will again. At that price you should be able to adjust height and vacuum carpet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Great suction/vacuum easy to empty/clean
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum BUT the long handle attachment for vacuuming base boards, windows and such is such a hassel, so bulky, not user friendly. You literally have to hold the base with one hand and use the handle with the other just to ensure the vacuum base doesn't hit you in the back of the feet... anyhow great vacuum, easy to empty, hair gets stuck in roller but it is can be cleaned however if your roller stops working you've got to watch a YouTube video on how to remove the roller and clean off the barring. Stairs, it is lighter than most to navigate stairs but honestly I think stairs are going to be difficult with any vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: home4mk

customer_reviews.title: won't work on high pile carpet
customer_reviews.text: this machine is useless for most high pile carpet. Brand new, brush bar stops spinning after a few seconds. It's due to the tight seal suction head, pulls the brush down and makes the machine think there is a jam. DONT BUY. Tech support is useless, of course claiming COVID which is really starting to get more of an excuse for poor service than reality. Completely avoid this machine. Returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: dishonesty
customer_reviews.text: dec 13 2019---had problems with the extension chord--it continued to narl up and made it hard to use the vacuum--We contacted Dyson---they had us take to a ups store and-it was sent to dyson for repair. It was sent back to us without any repair or reason for it. I called Dyson--they had me send pictures in email to verify the problem---they said they did not get the email---they called the tech that delt withit---he told them that this machine was wore out and not repairable this was the most dishonest deduction ever---we purchased it in feb 2018---it still looks new---waiting for somone to deal with this
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very bad support for vacuum issues!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not a good vacuum, brush broke after 1 month, took it to the repair shop Dyson told me too, then Dyson refused to email/call with my technican
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky and feels cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I put my dyson together pretty quickly, assembly was easy. The vacuum itself has powerful suction which is all I really care about... but whenever I use it, the ball squeaks constantly, and it's quite annoying. It makes me feel like I may have spent a lot of money on something very cheap and flimsy. When I pick up the vacuum, I feel the same way as well. It is lightweight, which is a plus, but the plastic also bends a bit, which is a bit concerning. The hose nozzle never stays locked into place either, I've found it poking out after lifting the vacuum. Not sure if the money is worth it, only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding maneuverability and pet-performance
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding, period. Feels a tad flimsy / delicate at first, but it is a top-notch vacuum design; best I've ever owned. This thing is probably half the weight of my Hoover Wind Tunnel, and brings up amazing amounts of stuff from carpets I thought were clean. Outperforms any vacuum I've tried and does a fantastic job in this multiple-dog house. Actually sucks itself down onto the floor versus the Hoover just being heavy; the ability for it to steer around stuff and the awesome beater-bar performance makes this unbeatable. I will buy another if anything ever happens to this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I miss my old Dyson
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model Dyson for many years that is not produced anymore. Comparing the two - the newer machine feels a little flimsier? (I think in an effort to make it lighter weight the plastic does not seem to be as sturdy). The plastic hose is a little warped as well (possible during shipping?) because I have to bend it slightly in order to get it to lock back into place after use. The cord is shorter than my previous Dyson and therefore, I can't reach all of the stairs without changing outlets. The suction is fantastic for carpets and rugs! I really like that you can turn the brush head off for bare floors.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Katy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't assemble
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and the nozzle would not attach to the handle. I called and the rep was condescending, acting as if this was absurd and she had never encountered this issue before. Out of exacerbation, I sent her a photo and she immediately identified that the hose had not been installed properly. She instructed me to remove it and I was unable to. After an hour of time wasted, I decided to return to the old, but not-long-lasting Hoover Air. I have owned several of these, and, although they don't last for more than a few years, they are simple to assemble and work properly (at least on hardwood flooring).
customer_reviews.author: carolc84

customer_reviews.title: Will not work on Carpet!!
customer_reviews.text: This suction on this vacuum is too strong and it cannot be pushed over my new carpet. It will also destroy any rugs you accidentally push it over...the more expensive they are the more damage it will do! Granted, it works great to pull up dog hair and dust on wood floors (be sure to turn the brush off) but it will not pick up larger things like dead flies. I do not like having one vacuum for my wood floors. I would prefer a vacuum I can use for the whole house and on all floors. These limitations should have been clearly stated for consumers.
customer_reviews.author: C.B. Lynx

customer_reviews.title: Great suction, but deficient on amenities.
customer_reviews.text: This vacumn will get things cleaner than you have ever had them. The slim design is great for getting under edges of furniture and cabinets. However, I can see no way to reduce the suction so that I can vacumn light weight items (ie rugs and curtains). The cord is cumbersome to keep it from getting caught under the roller. The wand is very stiff and awkward. It clogs easier than any vacumn I've had, sometimes because it sucks so hard one cannot stop an item from going in. I also have not mastered reinstalling the wand onto the machine after its use. A test drive would be recommended if you can swing it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hill

customer_reviews.title: Best, Most Powerful Vacuum I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: So I read the reviews about this thing having too much suction power and was initially hesitant. Well, after buying this and using it for about a month, I can tell you those fears are Completely Unwarranted. I have medium to high carpet, and this vacuum works fantastic. Its got suction like no vacuum I've ever owned. I also own a virtually new Hoover Windtunnel, and this thing has WAY more suction. As long as your carpet isn't shag, and is installed (ie. no throw rugs) this vacuum should work great.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: Yasssss awesome vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great for a small scale apartment with all carpeting! We had an dirty old vacuum for the longest time that just wasn't picking anything up and recieved this as a wedding gift in april and we absolutely love it. The suction is fantastic and maneuvering this thing is a dream!! The only thing i could say bad about this vacuum is that its sometimes annoying to get the vacuum to click back into place or free stand without checking, or it will easily tip over. Havent tried it on hardwood floors yet, as i typically just sweep the small area of hard floor that we do have. Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Tia Cox

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Works very well and has the best ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works very well and has the best suction of any vacuum cleaner that I've used. This is my first Dyson and with 3 dogs and a cat I'm always cleaning (or at least I should be) and this gets all the hair off my carpets, couches and dog beds quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get the “best” vacuum on the market. Sadly, all of the accessories were missing from the box. Even worse, after only a few minutes of usage on mostly hardwood floors the vacuum clogs and begins to overheat. I tried taking it apart and putting it back together with no success. My return window closed after only a month and now I’m stuck with a very expensive vacuum that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold very much dirt before having to be emptied.
customer_reviews.text: The cylinder doesn't hold very much dirt before having to be emptied. I could only do one room at a time and then I had to empty it. It has great suction, but seems very small in comparison to the Upright Dyson. It tips over all the time and is not easy to control. It's nearly impossible to re package when sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Moorhead

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER VACUUM !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many vacuums, including Hoover, Sharp, and Electrolux. There has never been a vacuum like my Dyson. It is true, that it never loses suction, which was amazing to me, but the amount of dirt was unbelievable, avan after vacuuming with my Hoover, which I thought was doing a good job! I vacuumed a second time to see how much dirt was missed, and even more was vacuumed up! After that, there was no more! Abssolutely without a doubt the very BEST vacuum I have ever had the pleasure of owning...actually very satisfying to vacuum now ! INSTANT gratification.
customer_reviews.author: DHamp

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR PET OWNERS
customer_reviews.text: Best vacuum I have ever bought. Had a Dyson animal with a smaller tank and I hated always having to empty after half a room. This tank can hold through two carpeted rooms of husky infested territory. It continues to impress every use. The hose also offers great suction power with very useful detachable heads. However, the main joint where the hose connects to its extension tube can be a bit akward to handle. Other than that minor ergonomic challenge everything else about the vacuum is amazing. Highly recommended to anyone who owns large dogs. Got two whiskies and a cat.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as good as the original
customer_reviews.text: I had the original version of this Dyson upright and I absolutely loved it. So when it was time to buy a new one we purchased this new version of the same vacuum. It is absolutely awful. So disappointed. The pull out handheld portion stopped working has no suction at all. I can't use it in my couch or hard to get areas. It's very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Andersen Family

customer_reviews.title: I’m sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: This refuses to move on any of my very low pile carpets. It literally sucks so hard that it cannot be pushed or pulled on the carpets. Even worse is how usless this is for the stairs. I alternate between doing a bad job with the teeny, tiny attachment head or doing a bad job lugging the entire vacuum across each stair and dinging up the paint on my baseboards. What a foolish design.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Dyson
customer_reviews.text: Bought a second Dyson in April 2019. Worked great on existing floors of hardwood and carpeted bedrooms. Had new carpet installed in December 2019. DYSON WILL NOT PULL ON NEW CARPET. Company checked the machine, returned, and when I called again, informed me they know of this problem, but can do nothing about it. So I have a vacuum that is practically new (used every two weeks from April to December) that I can get nothing for. No exchanges, no refunds. What a bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: My third Dyson
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time (delivered in its own box, no additional packing). it took just a couple of minutes to put the machine together, so no issues with that. I used it yesterday to vacuum hard wood floors and carpet - i had zero issues with either. It has plenty of suction, a long power cable, is easily maneuverable and looks great. My ex is still using the original Dyson we purchased 14+ years ago. I have been using a refurbished Dyson for the past five years, that recently stopped being efficient, i'm hopeful that this new machine will be with me for may years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: easy to push
customer_reviews.text: small, easy to push, sucks like crazy. Small canister. not really a fan of the hose being in the handle, can be very cumbersome. oh! and it doesn't stay upright very good.
customer_reviews.author: JMag

customer_reviews.title: Super Great Product -  Super Suction - Deep Cleans
customer_reviews.text: Live in a multi level home. Now have a Dyson upright on all three levels. We have been Dyson loyal customers for 15 years. Yes they are pricey but, there is nothing on the market that has the suction of these Dyson models or the mobility, flexibility for using the hose, attachments and crevice tools. These products are simply amazing on all surfaces. Carpet, tile, hardwood does a great job on all. Especially on decorator areas rugs where you don't want to use the beater brush and just suction.
customer_reviews.author: David Gates

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!! By far the worst vacuum in the world!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely awful vacuum. It is extremely hard to push and if you do not push it fast enough the belt stops rotating and then it is absolutely impossible to push. Also you can only use the hand section if the vacuum is latched in the upright position and it is nearly impossible to get it to latch once it is unmatched. Last time I tried it took me 5 minutes of attempting to latch it before it actually stayed. This vacuum is absolutely unusable. We had to buy a cheap vacuum So we could actually vacuum our floors and that was 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: PEXBO LLC needs to send new dyson not used as new please
customer_reviews.text: PEXBO LLC, seems to have sent the family a used dyson but sold as new at $359. The wood carpet adjustment of the dyson did not work. We boxed it back up after a few minutes and sent it back within 2 hours for a full refund. I am so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Leeroy151

customer_reviews.title: This model is such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: We owned a Dyson vacuum for 15+ years and it was time to replace. Purchased this model and it has been a complete headache. Canister is smaller and dirt gets stuck where you have to remove the canister each time which is difficult to do. Dirt and dust goes everywhere. Taking the wand out to use is ok, but trying to get it back in is a nightmare. It does not just slide right back in. You have to work at it. Not at all the same quality as our original one. In honesty, I hate this vacuum. Missed the opportunity to return, so will have to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely impressive suction power
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is amazing! Took less than 5 mins. to put together. The first test use was on a 5x7' visibly-clean rug, that had been vacuumed with our ~2yr. old Dirt Devil about a week before, that this Dyson was to replace. The amount of dirt, and dust it got up was fascinating to say the least... the suction is really strong, and for a full-size vacuum, this is compact, lightweight and easy to move up and down stairs. Very happy with this purchase- plan to follow routine maintenance on the filters (rinse ~1 a month with water) to ensure it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels Cheaper than Other Dysons
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one and the canister vac at the same time to compare them. I went with the canister. That little sucker is amazing. I felt like this model was cheap. Dyson is no longer made in the UK but now made in China. You can tell. The ball design makes it feel loose. I had the older model Dyson yellow that lasted for 12 years. I was used to the solid feel of it and just flat out didn't like this vacuum. It's bulkier on stairs so the canister vac is the real winner. Go with it. It's cheaper and works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is an awesome vacuum. We have owned nothing but Rainbow for 30 years but when our last Rainbow blew the engine it was in the CoVid Crisis and we couldn’t afford a new Rainbow so we decided to “settle” for the Dyson. I absolutely love it! Easy set up, no smell if you leave it out, easy to empty the dirt, easy transition from carpet to hardwood. My cat noticed the difference in our carpet. I tell people that I didn’t get a new vacuum, I got new carpet. That is how well this works!
customer_reviews.author: M-Gpie

customer_reviews.title: Good suction. Flimpsy to store upright.
customer_reviews.text: Good suction on rugsand could see much had been removed into the canister. Thats important for a slim profile machine. Long cord but i still use a short extension. Have not tried on rugless, but seems heavy for that kind of job. THe slight issue is its flimpsy to store upright and handle keeps falling down unless i babysit it before i leave the room and push hard against a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Insight

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Dyson. Exhausting to use on carpet or stairs!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this vacuum has incredible suctioning power and turns on a dime. But, I would NOT call it "Multi-Floor". It works well on wood or tile floors only. It's impossible to push along a medium pile carpet. It just won't go! Also, the hose is super frustrating to use, it's stiff, inflexible, and constantly causes the vacuum to tip over. It was a ridiculous task to try and vacuum our stairs. I wish I could return this vacuum. I plan to email Dyson and see if there is anything they can do to help me!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Long Carpet
customer_reviews.text: First off, I am glad I went out and ordered my Dyson, it was on sale at the time and I went ahead and bought it. I has been a huge upgrade from my last cheap Walmart brand sweeper. It works great and picks up almost everything on the first run! Only negatives that I do have that it is somewhat heavy, so it hard for the wife to carry up the stairs but that's why she keeps my around. The Dyson is also not great on long shag carpet, so just keep that in my mind before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Malone

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This was nice for maybe 3 days. Don’t even think about using it on the steps. Once you take it apart to clean the filters, it will never work again. Their customer service for dyson is never working. I’ve requested help 3 times. We can’t even empty ours because it will not release itself. It was a terrible purchase and an expensive piece of plastic that is now trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum ive ever had!
customer_reviews.text: Greatest vacuum I've ever used. I love how quickly and easily it moves in and out of hard to reach areas. It also transitions to the handheld nozzle very quickly. Power is great and doesn't taper off as the vacuum fills. Easy to clean and relatively easy to assemble, though the directions are entirely pictures (no words) so it can be a little confusing. My only issue is there isn't any bristles height adjustment (at least not on this model) so with thicker carpet it can be a pain to move around (also tall carpet can trigger the bristles to automatically stop working, requiring you to turn them on over and over while cleaning).
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Love Dyson brand vacuums!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Dyson that had finally seen better days. I like this one even better than the old one, because they decided to make the electric cord longer, so I don't have to keep moving it quite so often. I like the maneuverability of the Dyson. They are relatively small, but can get under cabinets, couches, chairs and beds fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: 2Okies

customer_reviews.title: DYSON IS SO HELPFUL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it this product for a short time... (2months) I called the number on the Dyson cause I was having problems with the Dyson not sucking up properly. They asked only a few questions. And told me exactly what was wrong. And they explained how to fix it. SUPER EASY TO FIX. I RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO EVERYONE. VERY VERY HELPFUL!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on carpet of any height
customer_reviews.text: This does not work on carpet. We have an extremely low pile carpet in our living room and every 5 seconds it stops rotating. Apparently the company recommends drilling holes in the bottom so the suction isn't so strong... WHAT!? This is a huge design flaw and should not be up to the consumer to fix. If we drill wrong then what are the chances the company will accept a return... none. Really disappointing a $400 vacuum doesn't vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible design
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood floors, tile floors, carpeting, stairs, etc. and this vacuum cleaner is NOT easy to maneuver from one room to another. It's almost impossible to use the attachments for hardwood or for steps since the "hose" is so tight (won't expand). All your energy is used fighting with the hose. I vacuum less now because I just do not like this machine. I don't think there was any usability studies done with real people...poor design all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine A Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best.  Vacuum.  Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Dyson vacuums over many years. The very first was bulky and difficult to use as the attachments and other aspects hadn’t been designed as well as the engineering for suction. This one is the perfect evolution. It’s ridiculously easy to maneuver, light enough to carry, and sucks up everything without issue - even long dog hair, which basically incapacitates other vacuums with any length of use. I have enjoyed using a Dyson rechargeable stick vacuum for smaller jobs, but don’t see the need for it anymore; this one covers all the territory without tiring me out and I’ll break it out for small spills, too. Bravo Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: Persevere

customer_reviews.title: Sucks a lot!!
customer_reviews.text: The suction power on this is excellent. I ran my old vacuum over the carpet and then this one - this one picked up a lot more. I read the negative reviews about this not working on carpet. Have no idea what they are talking about. Worked well on mine. Sooooo, Im really happy with this one. Five stars cus it SUCKS!! And that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Paul

customer_reviews.title: Way over designed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this vacuum ! Alas it was not to be . It was a bit to heavy to drag around the house for me and had way to many bells and whistles! Every inch of the thing has a clip, clamp or attachment and the roller ball thing made it impossible to clean under chairs and couches .... super cool looking but much to fussy Big plus was the Uber suction probably good if you have wall to wall carpet which we do not !!
customer_reviews.author: Laur

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1.5 years of use. Don’t spend you’re $ on this.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 1.5 years and it is already broke. It will not stand upright anymore and one of the tubes is broken or out of place. I can’t figure out how to fix it. Hopefully the warranty will cover the repair but I don’t think it will. This was a huge waste of money. Luckily I held onto my old $75 15 year old Bissell so I’m able to still vacuum my house while I wait to hear back from customer service. Overall I am very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Hot Mess!!
customer_reviews.text: This vacum is horrible. It is heavy and cumbersome to use. The suction is strong...but so much so that is does not work on all carpets. When I called the Dyson helpline to discuss, they acted as if this was no problem. They said that some types of padding prohibit the vacume from working. I bought the vacume for carpets...and nowhere is there any disclaimer that it won't work on some wall to wall carpets. I would understand if I had a very thick shag .....but my carpet is a low pile!! Stay away from this vacume!!
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Brushbar broke 45 days after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 1 year and 45 days. Dyson did a real good job in determining the optimal length for their warranty period. One side of the brush bar stopped spinning just less than 2 months after my warranty expired. Replacement part is $60; I'll just get a brand new "cheap" non-dyson vacuum instead. The main reason I bought this vacuum was because of the Dyson name and I figured it would hold up well. I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: James Hetfield

customer_reviews.title: Dyson is the best for a reason
customer_reviews.text: The fan is great and it has amazing suction. The only bad thing is that if you have any rugs that have a thicker pile or if you have oriental rugs it will barely move and you’ll have to push it because it allegedly “senses” the surface it’s vacuuming. It works great on laminate and hardwoods and low pile carpet. Great accessories as well
customer_reviews.author: Delano J

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is decent. I was hoping for slightly better suction power from all the hype of a dyson that I was hearing before I purchased this but it seems to be alright with most basic tasks. The moving plate can sometimes get in the way of sucking up debre. It can get clogged pretty easily and taking it apart to find the clog definitely has proven to be a hassle and requires patience. Other than that it's a good vacuum overall.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah R Carr

customer_reviews.title: Unit CANNOT Be Used On Thick/Plush Carpet!!!!!  WARNING
customer_reviews.text: The suction on this model is so strong that it CANNOT be used on thick/plush carpet! The Dyson description for product use states that this model can be used on carpet, but it does not warn potential purchasers that certain carpet thicknesses are problematic for the unit and that the suction strength cannot be adjusted to compensate. Completely misleading!!!!! A waste of $300...and no help from product support or warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome suction!
customer_reviews.text: Best vacuum I ever had. Awesome suction, easy handling. A little heavy and the long cord can be a hassle but it's worth it because it does a really good job at getting my carpets and floors super clean so I don't have to vacuum as often. Easy to clean the filter and that's important to keep the suction optimal. It was harder to take the cover off the beater to clean that after I had sucked up something that really had to get cleaned out of there. I found help on a youtube video so problem solved. This vacuum is worth every penny. I wish I got one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have friends who own this vacuum cleaner and they love it. It cleans very well it is just
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and I found it to be extremely difficult to put together. Returned the product. However, I have friends who own this vacuum cleaner and they love it. It cleans very well it is just heavy
customer_reviews.author: Maximillion

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I moved from an apartment with all wood floors to one with all carpeting. My Bissell vacuum of 3 years capped out on me, so I decided to invest in a better vacuum after reading reviews online. I was a little worried about the price and if it was worth it after reading some bad reviews, butI LOVE this Dyson and I have a newfound love for vacuuming my place! I haven't run into any issues, but I do find the hose hard to work with and not practical to use on anything but really hard to reach surfaces. If you're on the fence, I'd recommend going for it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Suction too strong
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't read the reviews prior to buying. This does not work on 3/4th of the carpet in my house - the suction is SO strong that you literally can't move it and the brush stops turning. I have a combination of low pile, somewhat plush, and medium. I only works with the medium/old style carpet. It would be a great option if you have only hardwood, as the suction power is amazing. I called Dyson and they said this vacuum was not suited for my house and offered a exchange/refund. After to reading reviews, this appears to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amy TApp

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on carpet
customer_reviews.text: This works great on our wood and laminate floors, but doesn't work at all on any of our carpets. We do not have high-pile carpet, they're all a pretty standard medium pile (with fibers less than 1/2 inch). When you try to use this vacuum on carpet, it just suctions to it and you can't move it. The beater bar does not work; it freezes when you use it on carpet. I was pretty disappointed, but am keeping the vacuum since we have mostly hardwood and I don't want to pay to return it.
customer_reviews.author: New Yorker with cat

customer_reviews.title: Dyson Perfection
customer_reviews.text: It's a Dyson... sez it all. I love this vacuum. It is super well constructed, lightweight and easy to move. It has the ability to turn the roll brush off and on depending on my needs. The only criticism is that the crevice tool is kinda awkward to pull out and use. Perhaps I just haven't figured it out yet? Regardless, I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Lilyles

customer_reviews.title: Love how easy and efficient it is!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it a couple weeks now. Prior to purchasing I had read reviews where they said it was too hard to use on the thick carpet and recommended for hard floors - that made me concerned. However, it worked great with the new carpet in my 1100sqft apartment. I love how easy it is to maneuver, which makes it fun to use. I've wanted one of these for years and wish I purchased sooner. If my viewpoint changes over time I'll be sure to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: PenokeeRanger

customer_reviews.title: Light weight easy to use but a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I owned a similar older unit that was built to last, but a little heavier. This unit feels really cheap, but then my main vacuums are Miele uprignt built like a tank and heavy as well, Miele canister which are excellent machines but the Dyson feels like half the wieght easy to maneuver and sucks like crazy. I always feel like I am about to break off the cord holder swivel hook as it is really thin, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: holisticguy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible hose tension
customer_reviews.text: Really hate the attachment hose. It is so hard to extend. It's completely tiresome to use the wand. You have to anchor the vacuum with one foot just to be able to tug the hose out long enough to use it in close range. It's ridiculously hard. Fusing said they would replace the hose but it never arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Books

customer_reviews.title: Good suction, cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: You’d think for the price this would be a fantastic vacuum, I disagree. For regular push and pull floor cleaning it works fantastic, but the hose is anything but good. I previously had an Electrolux and it worked so much better. You’d think for $300 the quality wouldn’t be so flimsy and shotty, but it’s like they focused all their quality on the main head and let a toddler design the remainder of the vacuum. I returned it after not even owning it for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great value.. Great vacuum..
customer_reviews.text: Great suction and easy to use not for thick carpet because of the great suction. It's hard to push in heavy carpet but just because of the suction power..careful near the hose attachment vent, IT WILL suck you to it, long sleeves, hair. Make sure it's upright it takes to clicks or it'll fall back down..
customer_reviews.author: joseph owensby

customer_reviews.title: After just a few uses it stopped working after using ...
customer_reviews.text: It's brand new. It has already stopped working properly after using it for 10 minutes. Looked up support ideas. There are no clogs anywhere, but they say it's overheated. It worked great until then. I have no children and so it doesn't get used a lot. This is supposed to be the vacuum that never clogs and has great suction. ???
customer_reviews.author: L VH

customer_reviews.title: The most powerful light vaccuum
customer_reviews.text: I had the first Dyson Ball vaccuum and didn't think Dyson could improve it much. The second model is noticeably more powerful, slimmer, and lighter. The down side is that it picks up so much dust that it fills the dustbin after one pass through my house. The dust gets so compacted that it doesn't drop easily out of the bin.
customer_reviews.author: papaya38

customer_reviews.title: Warranty no good and vacuum rther
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my wife in February 2018 and in October 2018 she was using 8t when it started smoking and keep our breaker and never worked again so I connected Dyson and 2 months later still not done anything or trying to I paid over 300 dollars forbit. Amazon is showing I only had month for warranty so for 350 dollars no happy with this deal
customer_reviews.author: Chris holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy, heavy and difficult to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I had a Dyson animal purple, it was great. This Dyson Orange is quite horrible. First off its the heaviest Dyson Ive ever used and the clumsiest by far. The extension wand never wants to go back in. Its always a struggle when I use the attachments. The canister is by for the most delicate, don't even attempt tp pick up the vacuum from there. The only other place is from the top, again flimsy. Its a plastic snap on piece that also feels ready to snap. Im scared to carry this thing up and down the stairs. Im sooooo mad I threw away the box, want to return very badly. I do not recommend this vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: AGC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my old Dyson original vacuum and checked the reviews on this model. I was slightly hesitant to buy due to some of the reviews saying it was hard to push on carpet. I was glad I purchased it because it is NOT hard to push on carpet and couldn't believe the dirt it sucked up that the old Dyson left behind. Do not hesitate to buy this vacuum!!! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Dyson
customer_reviews.text: I was like a kid on Christmas Day when this came. I opened it up and put it all together easily and it worked perfect right from the start and did an outstanding job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Vacuum, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! What an upgrade! I used the first dyson ball multifloor 1 for about a year and this one has been improved! It is lighter, has more suction, and more munevability with the ball! I absolutely LOVE this vacuum! I am a big believer in Dyson and believe it is well worth the money. I got this one on sale for $100 off and sometimes you can get a refurbished one even cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Neuschwander

customer_reviews.title: This machine has powerful suction.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it a 4 star rating is the weight. I'm a 70 year old woman and fairly strong for my age. The machine is quite heavy and kicked my butt the first couple of times I used it. I've gotten used to it except when I must lift it up and down a step into my living room. Otherwise it picks up all the dirt and pet hair, yay!
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Super vac. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Look. I am not exaggerating. We have 3 big dogs and my wife destroys, yes destroys, vacuums! I had been buying her a new one every 7 or 8 months. We have had this one for over a year and it is stiil going strong. I know it is a bit expensive, but i am shocked it still works and works well. Only neg is small dirt holder, but just empty every time anf its fine.
customer_reviews.author: NATHAN

customer_reviews.title: Missing key part and accessories
customer_reviews.text: Missing wand and accessories (combination tool and stair tool). I have to purchase the wand from the manufacturer and accessories that should have came with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett A.

customer_reviews.title: The Instructions Suck
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions only have pictures, and very few words, and several key steps are just left out. I only have two doctorates, but it took a call to their help line (and, in fairness, they were very helpful) to get the thing up and running. It also clogs easily. I was much happier with my old Bissell, which we gave to one of our kids. Doubt that we will go with this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and unwieldy
customer_reviews.text: This vaccum is heavy and unwieldy. The big ball, which is touted as allowing the machine to move around corners etc., in fact means that you are constantly working against it to just make the thing go in a straight line. It freezes up on area rugs as well. I guess the bonus is that I am working on my core the entire time as I fight the vaccum's effort to turn this way and that. Not recommended if you have a bad back or are not strong!
customer_reviews.author: C. Oram

customer_reviews.title: Do not by if you have thick carpet!
customer_reviews.text: Dyson needs to put a disclaimer- this is not multifloor! It is extremely hard to push of thick carpet. It suctions down and the brush stops moving. Do not buy if you have high quality thick carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bingaman

product_meta.title: Dyson Upright Vacuum Cleaner, Ball Multi Floor 2, Yellow
product_meta.description: The Dyson Ball Multi Floor 2 has unrivaled Dyson Suction*, and is light to maneuver. A slimmer design allows the Multi Floor 2 to turn on a dime, steering easily into difficult spaces. It's ideal for homes with hardwood, tile, and carpets. The Multi Floor 2 has an advanced self-adjusting cleaner head that automatically adjusts between all floor types - sealing in suction for a powerful clean across your entire home. Its wand and hose release in one smooth action to make it easier to clean up high and under furniture. With hygienic bin emptying, there's no need to get your hands dirty - just push the button to release the dirt. Whole-machine filtration ensures that allergens and bacteria are trapped inside the machine, not expelled back into the home. Dyson free 5 year warranty covers parts and labor, plus free shipping there and back. *Suction tested to ASTM F558 at the cleaner head, dust-loaded against upright market.
feature_bullets: Self adjusting cleaner head seals in suction across carpet, wood, vinyl, and tile floors
Dyson technology helps create a cleaner, healthier home - Our vacuums and purifiers are scientifically proven to capture particles as small as allergens and bacteria.
Radial root cyclone technology captures more microscopic dust than any other on the market;Cord Length:31 feet
Instant release wand allows for cleaning up high or under furniture; Dimensions (HxWxD): 41.93 x 15.59 x 13.39 inches & Weight: 15.6 pounds;Maximum Reach:40 feet
Hygienically empty the bin with the push of a button

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,440 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
